title: Study: 1.2 Billion Climate Refugees Expected by 2050 Without Action
introText: A comprehensive study projects that 1.2 billion people could be displaced by climate change by 2050 if current trends continue. The research calls for urgent international frameworks to manage climate migration.

content.content: The study, published in Nature, projects 1.2 billion climate refugees by 2050 under current emissions trajectories. Water scarcity, crop failure, and extreme heat will make large regions uninhabitable.
Sub-Saharan Africa, South Asia, and Central America face the greatest displacement risk. Small island nations may be entirely abandoned as sea levels rise.
International law does not recognize climate refugees. The study calls for new legal frameworks, planned relocation programs, and massive investment in climate adaptation.
